case.name: Clayton Robert Croker v Secretary, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations [2006] FCA 1257 (22 September 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: application for review from decision of director-general of social services
appeal to federal court of australia from "decision" of tribunal
competence of appeal from preliminary ruling of tribunal that it has jurisdiction to review decision
competence of appeal from an interim order of tribunal staying operation of decision
what constitutes a "decision" of the tribunal

citances.sentence: 118 In June 2006 the defendant applied to the Administrative Appeals Tribunal for an order staying the decision of the SSAT. The AAT dismissed the application ( Re Croker and Department of Employment and Workplace Relations [2006] AATA 536). This proceeding is not relied upon by the plaintiff as a vexatious proceeding. In September 2008 the defendant appealed to the Federal Court, pursuant to s 44 of the Administrative Appeals Tribunal Act 1975 (Cth). Upon being satisfied that there was no error of law, Buchanan J dismissed the application with costs ( Croker v Secretary, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations [2006] FCA 1257). In October 2006 the defendant sought leave to appeal from the decision of Buchanan J. Gyles J found that there was no reason to doubt the correctness of the decision of Buchanan J and dismissed the appeal with costs ( Croker v Secretary, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations [2006] FCA 1447).
